Description: Red pottery ostracon, perhaps from the body of a vessel, with remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, the first, which begins with the Chi-Rho symbol, appears to have been intentionally erased.
Curator's comments: On the acquisition see: B. Muhs and T. Vorderstrasse,' Collecting Egyptian Antiquities in the year 1838: Reverend William Hodge Mill and Robert Curzon, Baron Zouche', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology (2008), pp. 223-245.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.56, pl.42)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82657) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82657)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 42:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
